name: Copycat Egg Bites in the Instant Pot®
description: Famous coffee chain copycat egg bites recipe for the Instant Pot® includes cheese, green onion, red pepper, and spinach.
recipeIngredient: ½ jarred roasted red pepper, diced

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1 cup water to a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®). Place a steaming rack in the bottom of the pot.

Combine eggs, Gruyere cheese, and cottage cheese in a blender; process until smooth. Add spinach, roasted red pepper, and green onion to the blender. Pulse to combine. Divide mixture evenly amongst the indentations of a silicone egg bites mold. Tightly cover with aluminum foil and place onto the rack inside the Instant Pot®.
Close and lock the lid. Select Steam function according to manufacturer's instructions. Make sure vent is set to sealing. Set timer for 10 minutes. Allow 5 to 10 minutes for pressure to build.

Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions for 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.
Remove silicone mold from the pot and allow egg bites to cool about 5 minutes before serving.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Copycat Egg Bites in the Instant Pot®

review.reviewBody: I liked the idea of doing in the instant pot.  They came out beautiful and light and fluffy.  But a little on the plain side.  I did use different cheeses…cream cheese and cheddar.  Ill try again but I’d want to bump the flavor up…a lot!  Maybe dried tomatoes and sharp cheese!

Since I refuse to spend any more money on the expensive egg bites from that famous coffee shop, I wanted a “make ‘em at home” recipe. This recipe was perfect. The instructions were clear and easy to follow AND the results were delicious! The only change I made was to add a bit of salt and pepper to the egg mixture. This simple and versatile recipe is a keeper. I plan to create lots of eggs bites using different types of cheeses and add-ins. Thanks for sharing! I’ll definitely be making these again and again.

I have to admit, I've never had an "egg bite" before, so I can't compare how these rate to the popular coffee house's expensive version, but I'm sure the young adults in my household will know! I made a few minor deviations from the recipe. I used jarred chopped pimentos, used the trivet that came with my Instant Pot instead of a steaming rack, and covered my silicone mold with the plastic cover that it came with. The mixture was EXACTLY the amount to fill my 7 hole silicone mold, each slot to the top. They do puff up a bit, which I was worried about with my tight fitting cover, but it worked out just fine. These are quick and easy to throw together and they are delicious! I'm looking forward to trying other add-ins, and I'm sure these will become a regular breakfast item in this house! Thanks for sharing your recipe!
